intro: Hieracium abastumanense, commonly known as the Abastumani hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts. The plant is characterized by its yellowish-orange flower heads and hairy stems. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
